metadata.title: Select agent regulations
metadata.abstract: Several events over the past two decades have changed the way scientists acquire and work with pathogenic microorganisms and toxins in the United States and internationally. The Select Agent Regulations, which were promulgated by CDC and APHIS to address concerns raised by these events, have been in effect for more than 20 years. Knowledge of these and other regulations that will impact the practice of microbial forensics is essential.
metadata.author: Stephen A. Morse, Bernard R. Quigley
